name: Dhruv Gautam
short_description: Computer Science student at UC Berkeley with research experience in AI safety and interpretability. Currently a researcher at Berkeley Artificial Intelligence Research (BAIR) and a research intern at Microsoft, focusing on agents and post-training methods.
long_description:
Dhruv Gautam is a Computer Science student at the University of California, Berkeley, expected to graduate in 2025. He is currently a researcher at Berkeley Artificial Intelligence Research (BAIR) focusing on interpretability and safety, and a research intern at Microsoft working on agents and post-training methods with publications at ICLR 2025 and NeurIPS 2024.

His research experience includes work at Berkeley RISE Lab under both the Crooks Lab and Stoica Lab. Dhruv has also served as course staff for CS70 at UC Berkeley's EECS department.

Beyond his academic pursuits, Dhruv is actively involved in several campus organizations. He contributes to Launchpad (UC Berkeley) in ML Engineering and Education, and participates in Blockchain at Berkeley in Research, Governance, and Finance roles. He has also volunteered with the Berkeley Math Tournament.

Dhruv has received multiple recognitions including AIME Qualification four times from the Mathematical Association of America, the ASDRP Award for Excellence in Research, and The Leadership Award from the Cal Alumni Association.

He is multilingual, with native proficiency in English and Hindi, and professional working proficiency in Spanish.
